description: Borrowed from Late Latin causalis, from Latin causa (“cause”); see cause.

adjectives.description: causal (comparative more causal, superlative most causal)

entries.meaning: of, relating to, or being a cause of something; causing
examples: There is no causal relationship between eating carrots and seeing in the dark.

entries.meaning: (grammar) a word (such as because) that expresses a reason or a cause
